description: Ancient Greek κεραυνοσκοπεῖον (keraunoskopeîon), from κεραυνοσκοπία (keraunoskopía, “divination from thunder and lightning”) from κεραυνός (keraunós, “thunderbolt”) + σκοπέω (skopéō, “look at, consider”). Synchronically analyzable as cerauno- +‎ -scope.

entries.meaning: (historical) An instrument or apparatus employed in the ancient Greek mysteries to imitate thunder and lightning.
